alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Mahaska; Marion; Poweshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 11:10AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Poweshiek, northeastern Marion, northern Mahaska and southeastern Jasper Counties through NOON CDT... At 1110 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Sharon, or 9 miles east of Pella, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail and additional rainfall up to one inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. Locations impacted include... Pella, Montezuma, New Sharon, Sully, Lynnville, Deep River, Barnes City, Leighton and Searsboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for central and south central Iowa.
